articles.description:
Blockchain interconnectivity is going to be a big focus in the years to come, well beyond just EVM-compatibility. I recently had a fascinating discussion on this topic with Interchain Foundations’ Managing Director Maria Gomez and Product Lead for Inter-Blockchain connectivity protocol Susannah Evans. The Interchain Foundation have been instrumental in the building and development of […]
The post How Interchain are Building an Internet of Blockchains appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: How Interchain are Building an Internet of Blockchains

articles.author: Andrei
articles.description:
I recently had a great conversation with Michael Sanders, one of the Co-founders at Horizon. He and his team have built an incredible platform that allows game developers to easily access and use blockchain data in game development. This is the kind of tool that’s going to power the next paradigm shift in modern gaming. […]
The post What’s on the Horizon for the Future of Web3 Gaming? appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: What’s on the Horizon for the Future of Web3 Gaming?

articles.author: Andrei
articles.description:
What a journey it’s been so far. About 4 years ago, I decided to brush up on my backend programming skills. After trying working on some smaller projects, I decided to convert some of the trading bots that I had built on MetaTrader into Python. Some Backstory The first couple of bots I built were […]
The post Why we spent 2 years building an algorithmic crypto trading platform appeared first on cryptomaton.
articles.title: Why we spent 2 years building an algorithmic crypto trading platform

articles.author: Erik Knobl
articles.description:
One of the most overlooked features of Midjourney is the ability to include images in your /imagine prompt. This gives you the power to influence a prompt's basic visual structure. The more details this image has, the more it will influence your result.
Recently, I have been using very simple sketches created in Figma to influence my Midjourney prompts, and the results are amazing.
First, you can do this with Photoshop, Illustration, Canva, or other toolseven drawn sketches. However, for this tutorial, we'll be using Figma. If you want to learn more about Midjourney, check out my Beginner's Guide and Complete Guide to Image Effects.
Step 1: Background
Let's get started by creating a frame in Figma with the same shape as the image we want to make. In this case, we are using the 16:9 format …
articles.title: Crafting Beautiful Light Art with Figma and Midjourney

articles.author: Ϗ
articles.description:
Web3 gives users more control over their data and payments. Still, we pay for these benefits with increased technical and UX complexity. In recent years, blockchain ecosystems have tried to improve onboarding to get a hold of the UX part, but as many new chains sprouted, the technical complexities grew with them.
Account abstraction solves key management quite nicely. When a smart contract can decide when TXs are valid, nobody needs to juggle keys anymore, but wouldnt it be nice if we could abstract away the different chains altogether? NEAR leverages account abstraction, modular data availability, cross-chain liquidity networks, and composable decentralized frontends for chain interoperabilityone account for all chains.
This article explains what chain abstraction means in practice and ho…
articles.title: NEAR Chain Abstraction Explained
